sect2.title: About GNAT
sect2.para: Ada is a modern programming language designed for large, long-lived applications — and embedded systems in particular — where reliability and efficiency are essential. It has a set of unique technical features that make it highly effective for use in large, complex and safety-critical projects.

The compiler and associated tools on this page are known as the GNAT technology, developed by the Adacore company, using the GCC backend. Since parts of the Ada compiler are written in Ada, there is a circular dependency on an Ada compiler. The instructions below install a binary compiler. You do not need to do that if you already have built GNAT tools. The next section covers how to build GNAT once the circular dependency is satisfied.

sect2.title: Installation of GNAT Binaries
sect2.para: Install the x86_64 GNAT binaries by running the following commands as the root user while still in the directory the tarball is in:

screen.userinput:
export GNATTBPATH=$PWD && cd /opt && tar -xpvf "$GNATTBPATH"/gnat-x86_64-linux-&gcc-version;-1.tar.gz &&
ln -sv gnat-x86_64-linux-&gcc-version;-1 gnat && chown -R root:root gnat && cd $GNATTBPATH &&
unset GNATTBPATH

sect2.para: Or install the x86 GNAT binaries by running the following commands as the root user while still in the directory the tarball is in:

screen.userinput:
export GNATTBPATH=$PWD && cd /opt && tar xpvf "$GNATTBPATH"/gnat-gpl-2014-x86-linux-bin.tar.gz &&
ln -sv gnat-gpl-2014-x86-linux-bin gnat && chown -R root:root gnat && cd $GNATTBPATH &&
unset GNATTBPATH

sect2.para: Now adjust the PATH variable so the GNAT software can be found and used:
Ensure ld and as from the GNAT package aren't used as to prevent issues with aging by issuing the following as the root user:

screen.userinput: find /opt/gnat -name ld -exec mv -v {} {}.old \; && find /opt/gnat -name as -exec mv -v {} {}.old \;
